startup.details: Application starts successfully using 'uv run main.py' command. Pygame version 2.6.1 is properly installed and initialized.

dependencies.details: Pygame 2.6.1 (SDL 2.28.4) is installed and functional. All required modules (pygame, random, enum) are part of Python standard library or properly installed.

initialization.details: Game class initializes correctly with all components: Player at position (50, 520), 5 platforms, 5 ladders, goal area at rect(600, 30, 200, 50). Display resolution set to 800x600 at 60 FPS.

platforms.layout: Four horizontal girders across screen width, one goal platform at top-right

ladders.layout: Positioned to allow vertical movement between platforms

barrels.spawn_mechanism: Barrels spawn from Donkey Kong position every 180 frames (3 seconds)
barrels.behavior: Gravity-based movement, falls off edges, bounces off screen boundaries

goal_area.condition: Victory when player rect is fully contained in goal area

controls.movement: Arrow keys (Left/Right for movement, Up/Down for climbing ladders)
controls.action: Spacebar for jumping, ESC to quit
controls.responsiveness: Input handling implemented in main event loop

game_states.transitions: Collision with barrel triggers GAME_OVER, reaching goal triggers VICTORY

scoring.display: Score and barrels jumped counter shown on screen

rendering.style: Vector-style graphics with dark theme (RGB 20, 20, 30 background)
rendering.visual_elements: Player (green rectangle with eye and feet), Barrels (orange circles), Platforms (gray with texture), Ladders (brown), Goal (green), Donkey Kong (brown rectangle)

collision_detection.player_platform: Y-axis collision detection for ground detection
collision_detection.player_ladder: Center point containment check for climbing ability
collision_detection.barrel_platform: Platform collision with edge detection for falling behavior

ai_compatibility.observability: All game state accessible through class attributes and methods

summary: The Vector Climb Up - Donkey Kong Lite game application starts successfully and all core functionality is operational. The game implements a classic platformer with player movement, ladder climbing, jumping mechanics, barrel hazards, scoring system, and win/lose conditions. All game components (Player, Barrel, Platform, Ladder, Game) initialize correctly. The application is ready for AI training and gameplay.
